Is TSH the only thyroid test being done?  Your mother needs to have Free T3 and Free T4, along with the TSH, as TSH is totally inadequate as a diagnostic and treatment aid, by itself.  Free T3 is the most important because it correlates best with symptoms.If other tests have been done, please post the results and the reference ranges, which vary from lab to lab, so must come from her own lab report.It sounds as though the treatment for both your mother's thyroid and blood sugar is totally  inadequate.  Even at 350-400 her blood sugar is WAY too high.

If her TSH is 75 then she is sadly very hypothyroid and needs an increase in medication.  Probably up to 100 mcg, and then she should be retested in 6 weeks and maybe readjusted further.  She should also have the FT3 and FT4 tested.Uncontrolled thyorid will definitely impact on blood sugar controls.The insulin is definitely not enough with her sugars at 350 - 400 and there are risk of very serious complications.If her doctor is not taking this seriously and addressing it agressively you need a new doctor.  Read up on diabetes (she needs to be on a consistent low carb diet), and her insulin needs to be increased to bring her sugars down.
